snippet: The economic package would include the sale of state assets and the abolition of some state agencies, but would also offer incentives to companies that hire.
abstract: Italian government moves forward with a wide-ranging package of economic measures worth about 80 billion euros, or $101 billion, that are meant both to spur economic growth and make a dent in the country’s unsustainably large public debt.
lead_paragraph: The economic package would include the sale of state assets and the abolition of some state agencies, but would also offer incentives to companies that hire.

headline.seo: Italy Offers Plan to Spur Growth and Trim National Debt
headline.main: Italy Makes Plans to Cut Debt and Revive Growth
headline.print_headline: With Measures Worth $101 Billion, Italy Aims to Spur Growth and Trim Its Debt
